Articles.Content:
Hello fellow forum-goers and unnamed lurkers!

So I haven't been posting anything for about two weeks because, well, frankly, I've been super busy AND slightly disinterested in KSP. Burnt out temporarily, but indeed only temporarily. However, I thought it'd be fun to post a little thread detailing what I'm going to be up to in the next two weeks, something that I am super proud of and excited to be a part of.

The International Thespian Festival!

I've provided a link to the main page, but basically ITF is a big gathering of student actors, such as myself, from all over the nation and I believe a few other nations as well. I'm not sure which ones are going specifically, though.

Each year, ten schools from the US are picked to perform on the main stage, which means we perform for a nationwide audience. I am lucky enough to be a part of the designated Troupe 1887 from Riverton, WY, and we are performing "Unexpected Tenderness" (by Israel Horovitz) on the main stage!

MY school hasn't had the privilege to do so since, like, the 1970's, so it's a huge honor to be a part of this thing, and I figured that, if the wifi's good enough for me to make use of, maybe I'd give some reports on here about what the troupe and I are doing.

I'm still mainly inactive on the forums for the next two weeks, and as a matter of fact have a one-night only performance of the show starting here in about six hours, so I'll leave this here until I get more information.

This is so exciting! Thanks for reading, and I will be posting here with updates!
